item.title: Lorrie add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "In this sad world of ours sorrow comes to all and it often comes with bitter agony. Perfect relief is not possible except with time. You cannot now believe that you will ever feel better. But this is not true. You are sure to be happy again. Knowing this, truly believing it will make you less miserable now. I have had enough experience to make this statement." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Lorrie add a quote by John Green
item.description: "We all want to do something to mitigate the pain of loss or to turn grief into something positive, to find a silver lining in the clouds. But I believe there is real value in just standing there, being still, being sad." -- John Green

item.title: Lorrie add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you remember me, then I don't care if everyone else forgets." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Lorrie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To lose one parent may be regarded as a misfortune; to lose both looks like carelessness." -- Oscar Wilde
